title: PFB files viewer
content:
Is there any program like "Bitstream Font Navigator" can show us the PFB font files?  
I meant I have a lot of PFB file and I would like to arrange them in groups so I want to see the display of the font then decide which I should add to.

As you know, I can open them in FLS 5, but that will be a difficult task.

Please help.
author: H_Afash

comments.content: Whay doesn't anyone know such a program? Please help soon.

Proxima Software's [Font Expert 2005](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725104719/http:/www.proximasoftware.com/fontexpert/) not only lets you view complete character sets of Postscript, Truetype and Opentype fonts _and_ organize them into sets, but it also has a pretty nifty array of font specimen printout options. And it's relatively inexpensive.
Thank you, I will download the demo and see.

\>\> Font Expert 2005 not only lets you view complete character sets of Postscript  
Only if companion .pfm file is present in the same directory

The demo version of TypeTool or FontLab Studio 5: [http://www.fontlab.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725104719/http:/www.fontlab.com/ "http://www.fontlab.com")

A.
